definition: neutral gear
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
variant of 擋|挡[dang3]
to arrange/to put in order
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
see 放空擋|放空挡[fang4 kong1 dang3]
to coast along in neutral gear (in a car)/(coll.) to go commando

sentences.english: But he tried to appear calm as he instructed Griffith to put the car in neutral.
Leave a car in neutral gear.
sentences.chinese: 让汽车排挡置于空挡位置。

sentences.english: Q. I should still idle my car in really cold weather before driving, right?
sentences.chinese: 天气很冷的时候要开车前是要把车子挂空挡的吗？

sentences.english: SECURITY. Reverse alarm neutral start switch handlever parking brake.
sentences.chinese: 倒车报警器，空挡启动开关，手动驻车制动。

sentences.english: Just as he was unzipping, a London police officer showed up.
sentences.chinese: 就在他松开拉链的空挡，一个伦敦的警官出现了。

sentences.english: Leave a good safety margin between your car and the next.
sentences.chinese: 在你的车和下一辆车之间留出足够的安全空挡。

sentences.english: In addition, automatic-shift cars slide neutral, will cause damage to the car.
sentences.chinese: 另外，自动挡车子空挡滑行，还会对车子造成损害。

sentences.english: I even took up piano-playing again, finding that the small intervals of the provided sufficient time for both writing and piano practice.
sentences.chinese: 我发现那些小小的时间空挡足够用于写作和钢琴练习。

sentences.english: Allows the driver to select neutral and reverse gear.
sentences.chinese: 让车手选择空挡和倒车档。

sentences.english: At last a gap in the next lane opens. The driver stamps on the accelerator.
sentences.chinese: 终于隔壁车道上出现了一个空挡，司机踩下了油门。

sentences.english: Graham put the van in neutral and jumped out into the road.
sentences.chinese: 格雷厄姆把货车挂到空挡，自己跳到马路上。

definition: gap (between two objects)/interval of time (between events)/opening in one's schedule/free time/(fig.) gap (in the market etc)
gap/interval
crack/gap between two objects/gap in time between two events
interval/gap/clearance
see 放空擋|放空挡[fang4 kong1 dang3]
to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted
variant of 擋|挡[dang3]
to arrange/to put in order
to resist/to obstruct/to hinder/to keep off/to block (a blow)/to get in the way of/cover/gear (e.g. in a car's transmission)
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
(coll.) unexpectedly
to get out of the way
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
old variant of 趁[chen4]
to avail oneself of/to take advantage of
to whirl/to turn around quickly
(to stand or move) sideways
to stop in the middle of sth/intermittent/intermittence
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
